message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with automatic speech recognition using neural networks, which falls under the broad category of machine learning and artificial intelligence. The use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for feature extraction from raw speech signals is a recent development in the field of speech recognition, which is closely related to the sub-categories of natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV). Therefore, cs.SD (sound) and cs.CL (computation and language) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the comparison of different ANN architectures, which involves optimization and training of the models, making cs.LG (machine learning) another likely sub-category. The use of CNNs for feature extraction is a novel approach, which falls under the sub-category of neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper deals with the estimation of phoneme class conditional probabilities, which is a specific task in speech recognition and NLP, making cs.AI (artificial intelligence) another likely sub-category.
